commit.message:
Make sure we call setlocale

Before #330, this was done for use by readline, through the chain of calls
rl_initialize -> _rl_reset_locale -> _rl_init_locale -> setlocale

Fixes #342

Signed-off-by: Pietro Cerutti <pcerutti2@bloomberg.net>

Remove most of the rline wrapper

The rline wrapper is not used anymore as a proper wrapper for readline:
the gdb/mi interface handles readline events at gdb side.
In the future, we might want to reuse readline/linenoise for the status bar.

The only functionality left used is resolving key bindings by readline names.

I don't know how you feel about seeing good code being removed;
as of now, it's dead code and I think less code is often better code :)
Anyway, this is up for discussion.

Signed-off-by: Pietro Cerutti <pcerutti2@bloomberg.net>

Move file system code to std::string

CGDB is no longer reliant on char array's of size FSUTIL_PATH_MAX.
Now std::string objects are passed around to deal with the filesystem.

Signed-off-by: Bob Rossi <bob@brasko.net>

Show the most recently set mark

This changes how we keep track of marks, so that we can associate a list
of marks per line, and keep them ordered from most recently set to least
recently set to be able to display the most recent one.

Signed-off-by: Pietro Cerutti <pcerutti2@bloomberg.net>

Correctly detect global marks

This fixes a pre-existing bug. Setting a global mark X on line N of a
certain file then setting it on the same line N of a different file
would keep line N of the old file flagged as having mark X.
Functionally, jumping to mark X would correctly navigate to the new
file, but visually we would have two files flagged as having mark X.

Signed-off-by: Pietro Cerutti <pcerutti2@bloomberg.net>

Allow toggling marks with the `m` cgdb command

This enhances the `m` command so that setting the same marker again at
the same location has the effect of removing the mark.

As a side note, a location can have many marks, and the mark displayed
is the one with the lowest letter. We might want to change that so that
the most recent mark is displayed, but this requires more fundamental
changes to how marks are managed. I think I'd do that as a separate PR.

Issue #319

Signed-off-by: Pietro Cerutti <pcerutti2@bloomberg.net>

Add ', to jump to the executing line across files

The '. jump command only resolves the currently executing line in the
currently displayed buffer. When navigating source files, it's sometimes
convenient to be able to jump back to the currently executing line
across files. I've implemented ', as a variation of '. to do that.

Alternatively, if preferred, I can also implement the feature in the
original '. command.

Signed-off-by: Pietro Cerutti <gahr@gahr.ch>

Refactor

Signed-off-by: Pietro Cerutti <gahr@gahr.ch>

Merge ', into '.

Signed-off-by: Pietro Cerutti <gahr@gahr.ch>

Fix doc

Signed-off-by: Pietro Cerutti <gahr@gahr.ch>

Initialize member

Signed-off-by: Pietro Cerutti <gahr@gahr.ch>

CGDB will now stop highlighting the last search on a new failed search

Signed-off-by: Bob Rossi <bob@brasko.net>

Fix an empty string check

The variable terminal->textbuf is an array, not a pointer.

Signed-off-by: Pietro Cerutti <gahr@gahr.ch>

Keep kui_driver test code

Signed-off-by: Pietro Cerutti <gahr@gahr.ch>

Simplify kui_manager initialization

Signed-off-by: Pietro Cerutti <gahr@gahr.ch>

Avoid memory leaks on the failure path

Signed-off-by: Pietro Cerutti <gahr@gahr.ch>

Add kui README

Signed-off-by: Pietro Cerutti <gahr@gahr.ch>

Split the KUI library into C++ components

More automatic memory management via unique_ptr and shared_ptr. More
range-for loops and fewer uses of sentinels (see CGDB_KEY_ERROR). Fewer
useless checks on object construction. Methods are split from the giant
tui.cpp and split into modules. Now they can be looked at and further
improved in isolation.

The only real functional change is in the initialization of the term
capabilities triggered by kui_term_get_terminal_mappings: we now get the
environment and the terminal entry (tgetent) once for all keys.

Signed-off-by: Pietro Cerutti <gahr@gahr.ch>

Fix typos and small nitpicks in the docs

Signed-off-by: Pietro Cerutti <gahr@gahr.ch>

Remove unused include

Signed-off-by: Pietro Cerutti <gahr@gahr.ch>

Hide kui_tree's node into the cpp file

Signed-off-by: Pietro Cerutti <gahr@gahr.ch>

Reflow comments to 80 cols

Signed-off-by: Pietro Cerutti <gahr@gahr.ch>

Fix left-over doxy params

Signed-off-by: Pietro Cerutti <gahr@gahr.ch>

Make kui_tree real C++

As a side effect, we can get rid of a few checks for nullptr, reduce the
number of allocations, we provide better encapsulation, and a clearer
API.

Signed-off-by: Pietro Cerutti <gahr@gahr.ch>

Update the NOTES files regarding the previous fix

Signed-off-by: Bob Rossi <bob@brasko.net>

Set breakpoint using full file path

Some projects can have more than one file with the same name (for example
icmp.c in Linux).

Signed-off-by: Slawomir Stepien <sst@poczta.fm>
Update documentation copyright

Fix issue #293 - Random breakpoints are no displayed on file reload

Previously, when running cgdb, if you change a file you are debugging,
recompile the exe, and 'run' again in the gdb window in cgdb, cgdb would
reload the changed file and sometimes display garbage breakpoints.
Now only the correct breakpoints are displayed on reload.

Signed-off-by: Bob Rossi <bob@brasko.net>

Remove unused prototype

Signed-off-by: Bob Rossi <bob@brasko.net>

Fix issue #303 - CGDB crashes while resizing window

Previously if a lot of text existed in the gdb window, then a resize
could trigger a crash. Now no crash will occur.

CGDB now simply resizes the vterm, and vterm does not support reflow,
so the text is not redrawn as expected when the columns grow or shrink.
This may be noticable when switching between horizontal and vertical mode.
There is a feature request for reflow support in vterm.

The decision was made to switch from deleting and recreating a vterm
instance with all previous text, to just resizing it, because recreating
the vterm with a large amount of text turned out to be very inefficient.
Resizing would take 1 second with only tens of thousands of lines of data.

Signed-off-by: Bob Rossi <bob@brasko.net>

Update the NEWS file to reflect the major release

Signed-off-by: Bob Rossi <bob@brasko.net>

Remove outdated note about how to communicate with inferior

The user can naturally interact with the debugged program,
the same as they would using just GDB. This note is outdated and unneeded.

Signed-off-by: Bob Rossi <bob@brasko.net>

Update copyright date and release script

Signed-off-by: Bob Rossi <bob@brasko.net>

Remove couple of unused variables, other minor cleanup

Signed-off-by: Michael Sartain <mikesart@fastmail.com>
